company.name: 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.
company.address: 102 N.E. 2nd Street, Suite 195, Boca Raton, Florida 33432
company.business_description: 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is a mortgage company that advertises residential mortgage loans and operates websites through which it collects consumer loan applications. The company has sold or offered to sell completed applications to nonaffiliated third parties including mortgage brokers and lenders.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

complaint.factual_background: 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. sent spam emails advertising 3.95% 30-year mortgages and claimed to be a national mortgage lender. In reality, they were not a lender at all but sold consumer applications to third parties. They also falsely claimed to use SSL encryption to protect consumer financial information but failed to implement such security measures in numerous instances. They collected detailed personal and financial information from consumers through deceptive pretexts.

representations_made.description: Claimed that 3.95% 30 year mortgages and 3.95% APR 30 year mortgages were available from 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.
representations_made.quoted_text: In credit advertisements (including but not necessarily limited to Exhibits A and B), Defendants have represented, expressly or by implication, that A. 3.95% 30 year mortgages are available from 30 Minute Mortgage Inc., and B. 3.95% APR [annual percentage rate] 30 year mortgages are available from 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.

representations_made.description: Claimed that 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is a mortgage lender
representations_made.quoted_text: In the course of advertising on the Internet (including but not necessarily limited to Exhibits C and D), Defendants have represented, expressly or by implication, that 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is a mortgage lender.

representations_made.description: Claimed that pages asking for personal and financial information are delivered through HTTPS/SSL and that SSL technology is employed for transmission of such information
representations_made.quoted_text: In 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.'s online privacy policy (including but not necessarily limited to Exhibit C), Defendants have represented, expressly or by implication, that: A. The pages on Defendants' websites that ask for consumers' personal and financial information are delivered through "HTTPS" or SSL, and B. Defendants' websites employ SSL technology or other encryption for the transmission of personal and financial information.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be a national mortgage lender and California-based mortgage lender offering 3.95% 30 year mortgage loans
representations_made.quoted_text: In numerous instances, in connection with the marketing of residential mortgage loans, Defendants have employed pretexts to induce consumers to divulge their personal financial information. These pretexts include, but are not necessarily limited to, representing, expressly or by implication, that 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is a national mortgage lender and a California-based mortgage lender and/or that 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. provides 3.95% 30 year mortgage loans and 3.95% 30 year APR mortgage loans.

counts.title: False Mortgage Rate Advertising
counts.representation: 3.95% 30 year mortgages and 3.95% APR 30 year mortgages are available from 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.
counts.fact: 3.95% 30 year mortgages are not available from 30 Minute Mortgage Inc., and 3.95% APR 30 year mortgages are not available from 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.
counts.conclusion: Therefore, Defendants' representations as alleged in paragraph 19 above were, and are, false or misleading and constitute deceptive acts or practices in or affecting commerce in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: False Lender Status Claim
counts.representation: 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is a mortgage lender
counts.fact: 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is not a mortgage lender
counts.conclusion: Therefore, Defendants' representation as alleged in paragraph 23 above was, and is, false or misleading and constitutes deceptive acts or practices in or affecting commerce in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: False Security Claims
counts.representation: The pages on Defendants' websites that ask for consumers' personal and financial information are delivered through HTTPS or SSL, and Defendants' websites employ SSL technology or other encryption for the transmission of personal and financial information
counts.fact: In numerous instances: The pages on Defendants' websites that ask for consumers' personal and financial information have not been delivered through HTTPS or SSL; and Defendants' websites have not employed SSL technology or other encryption for the transmission of personal and financial information
counts.conclusion: Therefore, Defendants' representations as alleged in paragraph 27 above were, and are, false or misleading and constitute deceptive acts or practices in or affecting commerce in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: TILA and Regulation Z Violations
counts.representation: Defendants advertised credit terms for 3.95% 30 Year Mortgages and 3.95% APR 30 Year Mortgages
counts.fact: Defendants violated TILA and Regulation Z by: advertising credit terms other than those terms that actually are or will be arranged or offered by the creditor; stating a rate of finance charge without disclosing the accurate annual percentage rate and whether it may be increased after consummation, and advertising a payment rate without making other required disclosures; and stating the period of repayment but failing to disclose the terms of repayment and the annual percentage rate and whether the rate may be increased after consummation
counts.conclusion: By engaging in the violations of TILA and Regulation Z set forth in paragraph 34 above, Defendants have also violated the FTC Act.

counts.title: GLB Act Privacy Rule Violations
counts.representation: 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. collected nonpublic personal information from consumers and sold or was about to sell this information to nonaffiliated third parties
counts.fact: On information and belief, Defendants have not delivered, and are not about to deliver, privacy and opt notices that comply with the GLB Act and Privacy Rule, and have not given, and are not about to give, consumers a reasonable opportunity to opt out of disclosures of their nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties
counts.conclusion: Disclosure by Defendants of mortgage application information received by 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. to nonaffiliated third parties under these circumstances violates Subtitle A of Title V of the GLB Act and the Privacy Rule.

counts.title: Pretexting to Obtain Customer Information
counts.representation: Defendants employed pretexts including representing that 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is a national mortgage lender and a California-based mortgage lender and that 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. provides 3.95% 30 year mortgage loans and 3.95% 30 year APR mortgage loans
counts.fact: 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is not a national mortgage lender or a California-based mortgage lender, and 3.95% 30 year mortgage loans and 3.95% 30 year APR mortgage loans are not available from 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.
counts.conclusion: Therefore, Defendants' acts or practices violate Section 521 of the GLB Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821.

definitions.Assets: any legal or equitable interest in, right to, or claim to, any real and personal property, including but not limited to chattel, goods, instruments, equipment, fixtures, general intangibles, effects, leaseholds, premises, contracts, mail or other deliveries, shares of stock, lists of consumer names, inventory, checks, notes, accounts, credits, receivables, funds, and all cash, wherever located.
definitions.Customer information of a financial inst: synonymous in meaning and equal in scope to the usage of the term in Section 527(2) of the GLB Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6827(2).
definitions.Defendant: Peter W. Stolz and his officers, agents, servants, employees, subsidiaries, affiliates, successors, assigns, and all persons or entities in active concert or participation with him who receive actual notice of this Order by personal service or otherwise.
definitions.Document: synonymous in meaning and equal in scope to the usage of the term in Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 34(a), and includes writings, drawings, graphs, charts, photographs, audio and video recordings, computer records, and other data compilations from which information can be obtained and translated, if necessary, into reasonably usable form through detection devices. A draft or non-identical copy is a separate document within the meaning of the term.
definitions.Privacy Rule: the FTC's Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313. For purposes of Section IV of this Order, the terms "consumer," "financial institution," "nonaffiliated third party," and "nonpublic personal information" are defined as set forth in Section 313.3 of the Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 313.3.
definitions.Regulation Z: the regulation the Federal Reserve Board ("FRB") promulgated to implement TILA, 12 C.F.R. Part 226. The term also includes the FRB Official Staff Commentary on Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. Part 226, Supp. 1. The terms "annual percentage rate," "consumer credit," and "finance charge" are defined as set forth in Sections 226.2, 226.4, and 226.23 of Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. §§ 226.2, 226.4, & 226.22.
definitions.TILA: the Truth in Lending Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j.
definitions.Unsolicited Commercial E-mail: an electronic mail message that consists of or contains a communication advertising, promoting, soliciting, offering, or offering to sell any product or service, and that is not requested by the addressee or recipient or sent pursuant to a pre-existing business or personal relationship between the sender and the addressee or recipient of the e-mail.

provisions.title: Bond Requirements
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain a $1,000,000 performance bond before engaging in sending unsolicited commercial e-mail and maintain it for 3 years after ceasing such activities.

requirements.description: Obtain $1,000,000 performance bond prior to engaging in sending unsolicited commercial e-mail
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that Defendant Peter W. Stolz, whether acting directly or indirectly through any persons or entities under his control, is hereby permanently enjoined and restrained from engaging in the sending of Unsolicited Commercial E-mail, unless, prior to engaging in such activities, he first obtains a performance bond in the principal sum of $1,000,000 (One Million Dollars) ("Bond").

requirements.description: Maintain bond for 3 years after ceasing unsolicited commercial e-mail activities
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall maintain the Bond for a period of three (3) years after he provides notice to the Commission that he has ceased engaging in the sending of Unsolicited Commercial E-mail.

requirements.description: Provide notice to Commission at least 10 days before commencing activities requiring bond
requirements.quoted_text: At least ten (10) days before commencing any activity that requires obtaining the Bond, Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall provide notice to the Commission describing in reasonable detail said activities, and include in such notice a copy of the Bond obtained;

requirements.description: Include required disclosure when disclosing bond existence to recipients
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall not disclose the existence of any performance bond required by this Section to any recipient of Unsolicited Commercial E-mail, without also disclosing clearly and prominently, at the same time "AS REQUIRED BY ORDER OF THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT IN SETTLEMENT OF CHARGES OF FALSE AND MISLEADING REPRESENTATIONS IN THE USAGE OF UNSOLICITED COMMERCIAL E-MAIL."

provisions.title: Injunction Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from making false or misleading representations in connection with advertising or selling goods or services using the Internet or relating to residential mortgages.

requirements.description: Must not make false or misleading misrepresentations or omissions of material fact
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, in connection with the advertising, promotion, offering or sale of goods or services in or affecting commerce that are advertised or sold using the Internet (including but not limited to e-mail or websites) or that relate directly or indirectly to residential mortgages, Defendant is hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from making any express or implied misrepresentation or omission of material fact that is false or misleading, in any manner, directly or indirectly, to any consumer or entity

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent mortgage terms or rates available
requirements.quoted_text: including but not limited to misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: A. the mortgage terms or rates that are in fact available through them;

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is a mortgage lender
requirements.quoted_text: B. that 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. is a mortgage lender;

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent security measures employed on any website
requirements.quoted_text: C. the security measures employed on any website;

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent information material to a consumer's decision to provide personal financial information
requirements.quoted_text: D. any information material to a consumer's decision to provide personal financial information.

provisions.title: Injunction Against TILA and Regulation Z Violations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from violating the Truth in Lending Act and Regulation Z in connection with advertisements to promote consumer credit.

requirements.description: Must not advertise credit terms other than those actually arranged or offered by creditor
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, in connection with any advertisement to promote directly or indirectly any extension of consumer credit, Defendant is hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from violating TILA and/or Regulation Z by: A. advertising credit terms other than those terms that actually are or will be arranged or offered by the creditor, in violation of Section 226.24(a) of Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226.24(a);

requirements.description: Must not state a finance charge rate without disclosing accurate annual percentage rate
requirements.quoted_text: B. stating a rate of finance charge without disclosing the accurate "annual percentage rate," and, if the annual percentage rate may be increased after consummation, that fact, in violation of Sections 144(c) and 107 of TILA, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1664(c) & 1606, and Sections 226.24(b) and 226.22 of Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. §§ 226.24(b) & 226.22;

requirements.description: Must not advertise payment rate in negative amortization transaction without required disclosures
requirements.quoted_text: C. advertising a payment rate in a transaction where the consumer's payments are based upon a lower interest rate than the rate at which interest is accruing, without also making all other disclosures required by Section 226.24(b)-4 of the FRB Official Staff Commentary on Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226.24(b)-4, Supp. 1 (including the rate at which the interest is in fact accruing and the annual percentage rate);

requirements.description: Must not state repayment period without disclosing terms of repayment and annual percentage rate
requirements.quoted_text: D. stating the period of repayment, but failing to disclose: (1) the terms of repayment and (2) the annual percentage rate, using that term, and, if the rate may be increased after consummation, that fact, in violation of Section 144(d) of TILA, 15 U.S.C. § 1664(d), and Section 226.24(c) of Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. §

requirements.description: Must comply in all other respects with TILA and Regulation Z
requirements.quoted_text: E. failing to comply in any other respect with TILA and/or Regulation Z.

provisions.title: Injunction Against Violations of Subtitle A of Title V of the GLB Act
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from violating Subtitle A of Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act or the Privacy Rule.

requirements.description: Must provide privacy and opt out notices at required time and manner
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant is hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from violating, or assisting others in violating, any part of Subtitle A of Title V of the GLB Act or the Privacy Rule, including but not limited to: A. failing to provide privacy and opt out notices at the time and in the manner required by Sections 502 and 503 of the GLB Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6802-03, and Sections 313.4 to 313.9 of the Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. §§ 313.4-9;

requirements.description: Must not disclose nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties in violation of GLB Act
requirements.quoted_text: B. disclosing to any nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information about a consumerin a manner that violates Section 502 of the GLB Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6802, or Section 313.10 of the Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 313.10;

requirements.description: Must not reuse or redisclose nonpublic personal information received from nonaffiliated financial institutions
requirements.quoted_text: C. reusing or redisclosing nonpublic personal information received from a nonaffiliated financial institution in a manner that is prohibited by Section 502(c) of the GLB Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6802(c), or Section 313.11 of the Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 313.11.

provisions.title: Injunction Against Violations of Subtitle B of Title V of the GLB Act
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from obtaining or attempting to obtain customer information of financial institutions through false, fictitious, or fraudulent statements.

requirements.description: Must not obtain or attempt to obtain customer information of financial institutions through false statements or pretexting
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant is hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from violating, or assisting others in violating, any part of Subtitle B of Title V of the GLB Act, including but not limited to obtaining or attempting to obtain "customer information of a financial institution" (including but not limited to monthly mortgage payment amounts and account asset types and balances) by making false, fictitious, or fraudulent statements or representations to consumers or financial institutions.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, and on-site inspections.

requirements.description: Submit written reports within 15 days of FTC written notice
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, for the purpose of monitoring and investigating compliance with any provision of this Order, A. within fifteen (15) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall submit written reports in addition to those required by Section VII, sworn to under penalty of perjury;

requirements.description: Produce documents for inspection and copying upon FTC request
requirements.quoted_text: produce documents for inspection and copying;

requirements.description: Appear for deposition upon FTC request
requirements.quoted_text: appear for deposition;

requirements.description: Provide entry to business locations for inspection during normal business hours
requirements.quoted_text: and/or provide entry during normal business hours to any business location in his possession or direct or indirect control to inspect the business operation

requirements.description: Permit FTC to interview employees, consultants, and agents who agree to interviews
requirements.quoted_text: C. Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall permit representatives of the Commission to interview any employer, consultant, independent contractor, representative, agent, or employee who has agreed to such an interview, relating in any way to any conduct subject to this Order. The person interviewed may have counsel present.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, corporate structure, and file a comprehensive compliance report 180 days after order entry.

requirements.description: Notify FTC of changes in residence, mailing addresses, and telephone numbers within 10 days
requirements.quoted_text: for a period of five (5) years from the date of entry of this Order, 1. Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall notify the Commission of the following: a. any changes in his residence, mailing addresses, and telephone numbers, within ten (10) days of the date of such change;

requirements.description: Notify FTC of changes in employment status within 10 days
requirements.quoted_text: b. any changes in his employment status (including self-employment) within ten (10) days of the date of such change. Such notice shall include the name and address of each business that he is affiliated with, employed by, or performs services for; a statement of the nature of the business; and a statement of his duties and responsibilities in connection with the business;

requirements.description: Notify FTC of changes in name or use of aliases
requirements.quoted_text: c. any changes in his name or use of any aliases or fictitious names;

requirements.description: Notify FTC of corporate structure changes at least 30 days prior
requirements.quoted_text: 2. Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall notify the Commission of any changes in corporate structure that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including but not limited to a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order; the filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address, at least thirty (30) days prior to such change

requirements.description: File comprehensive compliance report 180 days after order entry
requirements.quoted_text: B. One hundred eighty (180) days after the date of entry of this Order, Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall provide a written report to the FTC, sworn to under penalty of perjury, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which he has complied and is complying with this Order.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, and marketing materials for 8 years for businesses advertising or selling goods/services via Internet or relating to residential mortgages.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records for 8 years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, for a period of eight (8) years from the date of entry of this Order, in connection with any business that engages in the advertising, promotion, offering or sale of goods or services in or affecting commerce that are advertised or sold using the Internet (including but not limited to e-mail or websites) or that relate directly or indirectly to residential mortgages where Defendant Peter W. Stolz is the majority owner of the business or directly or indirectly manages or controls the business, Defendant is hereby restrained and enjoined from failing to create and retain the following records: A. Accounting records that reflect the cost of goods or services sold, revenues generated, and the disbursement of such revenues;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records for 8 years
requirements.quoted_text: B. Personnel records accurately reflecting: the name, address, and telephone number of each person employed in any capacity by such business, including as an independent contractor; that person's job title or position; the date upon which the person commenced work; and the date and reason for the person's termination, if applicable;

requirements.description: Create and retain customer files for 8 years
requirements.quoted_text: C. Customer files containing the names, addresses, phone numbers, dollar amounts paid, quantity of items or services purchased, and description of items or services purchased, to the extent such information is obtained in the ordinary course of business;

requirements.description: Create and retain complaints and refund requests for 8 years
requirements.quoted_text: D. Complaints and refund requests (whether received directly, indirectly or through any third party) and any responses to those complaints or requests;

requirements.description: Create and retain copies of marketing materials for 8 years
requirements.quoted_text: E. Copies of all sales scripts, training materials, advertisements, or other marketing materials.

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must deliver copies of the order to employees, officers, and managers of covered businesses and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of order to employees, officers, directors, and managers for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, for a period of five (5) years from the date of entry of this Order, Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall deliver a copy of this Order to the employees (with responsibilities with respect to the subject matter of this Order), principals, officers, directors, and managers under Defendant Peter W. Stolz's control for any business that (a) employs or contracts for personal services from Defendant Peter W. Stolz and (b) engages in (1) the marketing, advertising, promotion, or offering of residential mortgages or services related to residential mortgages or (2) the marketing, advertising, promotion, or sending of Unsolicited Commercial E-mail.

requirements.description: Secure signed and dated acknowledgments within 30 days
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall secure from each such person a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of the Order within thirty (30) days after the date of service of the Order or the commencement of the employment relationship.

requirements.description: Maintain signed acknowledgments for 8 years
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant Peter W. Stolz shall maintain signed and dated acknowledgments of the receipt of copies of this Order, as required by this Section, until eight (8) years after the date of entry of this Order.

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of the order within 5 business days.

requirements.description: Submit truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant Peter W. Stolz, within five (5) business days of receipt of this Order as entered by the Court, shall submit to the Commission a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification and enforcement of this Order.

provisions.title: Monitoring Compliance of Sales Personnel
provisions.summary: Defendant must take reasonable steps to monitor and ensure that salespersons comply with the order, investigate complaints, and take corrective action.

requirements.description: Take reasonable steps to monitor and ensure salespersons comply with order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant Peter W. Stolz, in connection with any business engaged in (1) the marketing, advertising, promotion, or offering of residential mortgages or services related to residential mortgages or (2) the marketing, advertising, promotion, or sending of Unsolicited Commercial E-mail, where Defendant Peter W. Stolz is the majority owner of the business or directly or indirectly manages or controls the business, is hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from: A. Failing to take reasonable steps sufficient to monitor and ensure that all employees and independent contractors engaged in sales or other customer service functions ("salespersons") comply with Sections I, II, III, IV, and V of this Order. Such steps shall include adequate monitoring of sales presentations or other calls with customers, and shall also include, at a minimum, the following: (1) listening to the oral representations made by salespersons; (2) establishing a procedure for receiving and responding to consumer complaints; and (3) ascertaining the number and nature of consumer complaints regarding transactions in which each salesperson is involved;

requirements.description: Promptly investigate fully any consumer complaint
requirements.quoted_text: B. Failing promptly to investigate fully any consumer complaint received by any business to which this Section applies;

requirements.description: Take corrective action with respect to non-complying salespersons
requirements.quoted_text: C. Failing to take corrective action with respect to any salesperson whom Defendant Peter W. Stolz determines is not complying with this Order, which may include training, disciplining, and/or terminating such salesperson.

provisions.title: Prohibitions Involving Consumer Lists
provisions.summary: Defendant is restrained from selling, renting, or disclosing identifying information of persons who submitted information to 30 Minute Mortgage Inc., and from benefiting from such information.

requirements.description: Must not sell, rent, lease, or disclose identifying information of persons who submitted information to 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant is hereby restrained and enjoined from: A. Selling, renting, leasing, transferring, or otherwise disclosing the name, address, telephone number, credit card number, bank account number, e-mail address, or other identifying information of any person who submitted such information to 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. at any time prior to entry of this Order, in connection with the advertising, promotion, telemarketing, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service in or affecting commerce;

requirements.description: Must not benefit from or use identifying or financial information submitted to Defendant or 30 Minute Mortgage Inc.
requirements.quoted_text: B. Benefiting from or using the name, address, telephone number, credit card number, bank account number, e-mail address, or other identifying or financial information of any person who submitted such information to Defendant, Defendant Gregory P. Roth, or 30 Minute Mortgage Inc. as a result of, derived from, or otherwise related to the activities alleged in the Commission's complaint.

provisions.title: Fees and Costs
provisions.summary: Each party bears its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

requirements.description: Each party bears its own costs and attorneys' fees
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that each party to this Order hereby agrees to bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

provisions.title: Entry of This Judgment
provisions.summary: The Clerk shall enter this order immediately pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. P. 54(b).

requirements.description: Clerk shall enter order immediately
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, as there is no just reason for delay of entry of this judgment, pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. P. 54(b), the Clerk shall enter this Order immediately.

duration.termination_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification and enforcement of this Order.

source_files.complaint: 12.03, 30 Minute Mortgage, Inc., Gregory P. Roth, and Peter W. Stolz Complaint.pdf
source_files.order: 12.03, 30 Minute Mortgage, Inc., Gregory P. Roth, and Peter W. Stolz Order.pdf
